intro: Velaea toluccensis, commonly known as the Toluca velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed soils or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
